text: In ancient England, criminals sentenced to death had the right to sell their bodies alive to anatomists and physiologists. The money obtained in this way, they gave to their families or drank it. One of them, caught in a horrible crime, called a medical scientist in his place and, after negotiating with him to the brink, sold him his own person for two guineas. But when he got the money, he suddenly started to pack up... - the doctor was amazed. "You bought me, as a man to be hanged", said the criminal, charging, "but I scolded you! I'm going to be burned! I'm going to go. FIN 1885 Translation by René Portas. We thank Esteban Molina for his contribution to this story to the Ciudad Seva Digital Library.
title: Lo timó
author: Anton Chejov
